info.description: DBpedia Spotlight is a tool for automatically annotating mentions of DBpedia resources in text, providing a solution for linking unstructured information sources to the Linked Open Data cloud through DBpedia
info.title: DBpedia Spotlight

get.summary: Returns annotated text / entities from an URL
get.description: A 4(four) step process -  Spotting, Candidate Mapping, Disambiguation and Linking / Stats -  for linking unstructured information sources

parameters.name: support
parameters.description: how prominent is this entity in Lucene Model, i.e. number of inlinks in Wikipedia

parameters.name: policy
parameters.description: (whitelist) select all entities that have the same type;  (blacklist) - select all entities that have not the same type.
